required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of 2% Lidocaine Gel for Intrauterine Device (IUD) Insertion
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial of 2% Lidocaine Gel for IUD Insertion

lead_sponsor.agency: Women and Infants Hospital of Rhode Island

clinical_study.source: Women and Infants Hospital of Rhode Island

brief_summary.textblock: The intrauterine device (IUD) is a long-acting, highly effective, reversible contraceptive that may be underutilized due to fear of pain during insertion. Although providers frequently prescribe non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) for IUD insertion, there is no evidence for any pain reduction. In fact, no interventions evaluated in randomized controlled trials have been shown to be effective in reducing pain during IUD insertion. While many women tolerate IUD insertion well, others have moderate to severe pain. This double-blind randomized controlled trial of 150 women aims to estimate the efficacy of intracervical 2% lidocaine gel compared to placebo (KY jelly) to reduce IUD insertion pain. Our hypothesis is that women who are treated with 2% lidocaine gel prior to IUD insertion will have reduced pain as measured on a 0 mm to 100 mm Visual Analog Scale (VAS). We will be able to detect a 15 mm difference on the VAS with our sample size. Other data to be collected include information regarding age, BMI, obstetric history, lactation status, time since pregnancy or delivery, last menstrual period, history of cervical conization, anxiety levels, anticipated pain levels, insertion characteristics (time, difficulty, complications), side effects, and satisfaction with pain control. If 2% lidocaine gel is effective, then a viable, easily administered option for pain control will be available to providers and patients.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Pain Score During IUD Insertion
primary_outcome.description: 0 to 100 mm visual analog scale, higher values represent more pain.

arm_group.description: Will receive placement of inert glycerin gel on ectocervix and in cervical canal prior to IUD placement.
Will receive placement of 2% lidocaine gel on ectocervix and in cervical canal prior to IUD placement.

overall_official.affiliation: Women and Infants Hospital of Rhode Island

facility.name: Women's Primary Care Center/Women and Infants' Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Women and Infants Hospital of Rhode Island

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Will receive placement of inert glycerin gel on ectocervix and in cervical canal prior to IUD placement. Placebo gel: Inert gel x 1

group.title: Study Group
group.description: Will receive placement of 2% lidocaine gel on ectocervix and in cervical canal prior to IUD placement. 2% lidocaine gel: 120mg lidocaine x 1

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
